How can I define a basket currency using the command line and Verus, and what are the implications of doing so?

To define a basket currency, you can use the `definecurrency` command with the following format:
```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{
 "name":"SocialBrand", 
 "options":33, "currencies":["vrsctest"], 
 "initialsupply":500, 
 "preallocations":[{"Max@":1000}]
}'
```
This creates a basket currency called SocialBrand, where people can preconvert VRSCTEST into its reserves and receive 500 SocialBrand in return. The `preallocations` parameter allows for a chosen amount of funds to be directed to a specific VerusID (in this case, Max@) after the preconversion time frame has passed and the currency is launched.

Example currency:
``` json
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{
 "name":"SocialBrand", 
 "options":33, "currencies":["vrsctest"], 
 "initialsupply":500, 
 "preallocations":[{"Max@":1000}]
}'
```
☝️ This is a basket currency called SocialBrand. People can preconvert VRSCTEST into its reserves and in return they get 500 SocialBrand distributed among them. Immediately after launch Max@ receives 1000 SocialBrand, lowering the reserve ratio of the currency.### **"preallocations"**
Use this parameter to receive a chosen amount of funds after the preconversion time frame has passed and the currency is launched. Funds can be directed to VerusIDs and R-addresses. Works with simple token currencies and basket currencies.When using this parameter with basket currencies, after the preconversion time frame has passed and the currency is launched, the reserve ratio is lowered. This is because new currency has been minted after the initial supply (`"initialsupply"`) is distributed, and nothing was new added into the reserves.::: danger Limit for all currency supplies (10 billion)
10 billion (minus 1 satoshi) with 8 decimal places (9999999999.99999999) is now the recommended absolute limit for all currency supplies, including over time with conversions and extended tail emissions for blockchains.
:::### **"prelaunchcarveout"**
Only works with basket currencies (`options:33`). Use this to redirect a percentage of preconverted reserves to the rootID.
After the preconversion time frame has passed and the currency is launched, a percentage of the reserves is taken and redirected to the rootID. This lowers the reserve ratio, making the currency more volatile.
./raw_text_input_docs/launch-currency.md
What is the purpose of the "preallocations" parameter when defining a currency using Verus?

The "preallocations" parameter is used to receive a chosen amount of funds after the preconversion time frame has passed and the currency is launched. It can be used to direct funds to VerusIDs and R-addresses, and works with both simple token currencies and basket currencies. When used with basket currencies, it lowers the reserve ratio of the currency after launch.

Example currency:
``` json
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{
 "name":"SocialBrand", 
 "options":33, "currencies":["vrsctest"], 
 "initialsupply":500, 
 "preallocations":[{"Max@":1000}]
}'
```
☝️ This is a basket currency called SocialBrand. People can preconvert VRSCTEST into its reserves and in return they get 500 SocialBrand distributed among them. Immediately after launch Max@ receives 1000 SocialBrand, lowering the reserve ratio of the currency.### **"preallocations"**
Use this parameter to receive a chosen amount of funds after the preconversion time frame has passed and the currency is launched. Funds can be directed to VerusIDs and R-addresses. Works with simple token currencies and basket currencies.When using this parameter with basket currencies, after the preconversion time frame has passed and the currency is launched, the reserve ratio is lowered. This is because new currency has been minted after the initial supply (`"initialsupply"`) is distributed, and nothing was new added into the reserves.::: danger Limit for all currency supplies (10 billion)
10 billion (minus 1 satoshi) with 8 decimal places (9999999999.99999999) is now the recommended absolute limit for all currency supplies, including over time with conversions and extended tail emissions for blockchains.
:::### **"prelaunchcarveout"**
Only works with basket currencies (`options:33`). Use this to redirect a percentage of preconverted reserves to the rootID.
After the preconversion time frame has passed and the currency is launched, a percentage of the reserves is taken and redirected to the rootID. This lowers the reserve ratio, making the currency more volatile.

What is the recommended absolute limit for all currency supplies in Verus?

The recommended absolute limit for all currency supplies in Verus is 10 billion (minus 1 satoshi) with 8 decimal places (9999999999.99999999). This applies to all currency supplies, including those with conversions and extended tail emissions for blockchains.

Example currency:
``` json
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{
 "name":"SocialBrand", 
 "options":33, "currencies":["vrsctest"], 
 "initialsupply":500, 
 "preallocations":[{"Max@":1000}]
}'
```

What is the "prelaunchcarveout" parameter, and how does it work?

The "prelaunchcarveout" parameter is used with basket currencies (options:33) to redirect a percentage of preconverted reserves to the rootID after the preconversion time frame has passed and the currency is launched. This lowers the reserve ratio, making the currency more volatile.
